docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 17. -- Thornton Wilder's "The Skin of Our Teeth" was severely criticized but the Theatre Guild American Repertory Company was hailed for its "top level professionalism" here last night.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 17. -- Thornton Wilder's "The Skin of Our Teeth" was severely criticized but the Theatre Guild American Repertory Company was hailed for its "top level professionalism" here last night.

headline.main: MONTEVIDEO HAILS REPERTORY GROUP; Theatre Guild Unit Praised -- Wilder's Play Criticized

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended Sept. 15, 1961 British pound sterling continued to advance and the Canadian dollar remained steady in light trading during the past week.

docs.snippet: RYE, N.Y., Sept. 18 -- Twin brothers from Brazil swept the first two races today in the world championship regatta of the International Snipe Class on Long Island Sound.

docs.snippet: RYE, N.Y., Sept. 19 -- Axel and Erik Schmidt, 22-year-old twin brothers from Rio de Janeiro, maintained their lead today in the world championship regatta on the Snipe Class on Long Island Sound.
docs.lead_paragraph: RYE, N.Y., Sept. 19 -- Axel and Erik Schmidt, 22-year-old twin brothers from Rio de Janeiro, maintained their lead today in the world championship regatta on the Snipe Class on Long Island Sound.

headline.main: Brazilians Hold Lead in Snipe Regatta; SCHMIDT TWINS, 22, TAKE TWO SECONDS Brazilians Lead With 6,242 Points -- Spanish and U.S. Skippers Win on Sound

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 19 -- President Kennedy welcomed President Manuel Prado y Ugarteche of Peru today and said their two countries stood "shoulder to shoulder" in the fight for "a world at peace, a world of law."

docs.snippet: RYE, N.Y., Sept. 20 -- Crews of eighteen nations sailed the fifth race in the International Snipe Class series off the American Yacht Club today, fulfilling the minimum class requirements and making the regatta an official world championship.

docs.snippet: Former President Dwight D. Eisenhower put on an "I Like Louie" button yesterday, beamed at Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz and said, "He's my man."
